data.title: Remove unnecessary trait lookups when cloaking/decloaking.
Fix Defend stance auto-targeting naval structures.
data.body: Fixes #14118.

data.title: Units in Defend stance auto-target SPEN/SYRD
Rewrite and simplify GPS dots
data.body:
Closes #14115.

The GPS code is a giant hack that doesn't fit with the current engine design, and can't reasonably be changed without changing its behaviour.  #14115 shows that the legacy behaviour is controversial, and provides good motivation to rip out the problematic code.

The GPS dots are now purely visual, rendering for enemy actors who are (a) under fog (not shroud), (b) otherwise visible if the fog wasn't there (i.e. not cloaked), and (c) not already showing a visible frozen actor.  Disguised actors (i.e. spies) now show indicators in their effective owner color instead of being hidden.

data.title: SpawnActorPower causes probably unneccessary Lint warnings
data.body:
Hey,
When using SpawnActorPower the lint-check outputs weird warnings like this:
Those errors have started appearing with the latests series of playtests and ONLY appear like this on SpawnActorPower.
```
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Warning: Custom sprite image of actor wall is null.
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Warning: Custom sprite image of actor wall is null.
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Warning: Custom sprite image of actor wall is null.
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Warning: Custom sprite image of actor wall is null.
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Warning: Custom sprite image of actor wall is null.
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Warning: Custom sprite image of actor wall is null.
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Warning: Custom sprite image of actor wall is null.
```
Comparison with other powers has lead me to a suspicion. Here are the warnings for a nuke power without the firing actor having an `ActivationSequence` defined: (by setting `ActivationSequence=undefined` )
```
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Error: Sprite image wall from actor wall of faction Random does not define sequence undefined from field Sequence of OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.GrantExternalConditionPowerInfo
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Error: Sprite image wall from actor wall of faction atreides does not define sequence undefined from field Sequence of OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.GrantExternalConditionPowerInfo
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Error: Sprite image wall from actor wall of faction harkonnen does not define sequence undefined from field Sequence of OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.GrantExternalConditionPowerInfo
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Error: Sprite image wall from actor wall of faction ordos does not define sequence undefined from field Sequence of OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.GrantExternalConditionPowerInfo
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Error: Sprite image wall from actor wall of faction corrino does not define sequence undefined from field Sequence of OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.GrantExternalConditionPowerInfo
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Error: Sprite image wall from actor wall of faction mercenary does not define sequence undefined from field Sequence of OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.GrantExternalConditionPowerInfo
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Error: Sprite image wall from actor wall of faction smuggler does not define sequence undefined from field Sequence of OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.GrantExternalConditionPowerInfo
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Error: Sprite image wall from actor wall of faction fremen does not define sequence undefined from field Sequence of OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.GrantExternalConditionPowerInfo
```
Note that both of the warnings have 8 lines. So I guess some Interface got modified in the latest round of playtests and now requires some kind of activation sequence on SpawnActorPower, which isn't really  needed/defined in SpawnActorPowerInfo.

[Here](http://resource.openra.net/maps/23077/) is a map showcasing the error.

Please fix, I make heavy use of SpawnActorPower and my maps don't get the lint-approved-quality seal because of this ;)

data.title: Remove auto-target into fog of war from GPS
data.body:
There is a general consensus among competitive players that GPS has a negative impact on gameplay in its current state. One suggestion that has been touted by myself and others is to remove the ability for units to see and therefore auto attack into the fog of war at gpsdots. 

It can get silly for artillery to auto fire at assembling units long before their commander even notices what's going on. Also, as many RA units have greater firing range than their vision range, an allied player with GPS will get free shots off in most engagements. Tanya in particular can wreak havoc un-escorted with a simple A-move vs infantry dots.

Related forum post: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=20298&sid=7e3ec7f1fa9128dba116684efb44c997

data.title: Add ability for transprots to pick up their cargo
data.body:
Right now cargo/passengers can be ordered to go into transports but transports can not be ordered to pick up their cargo/passengers. Such feature exists in other RTS (Starcraft for example) and can be very useful. 

Imagine how much easier it will be to pick up stranded engineers (or Tanya). Now you have to first move the transport to where the passenger is and then order the passenger in (if you don't forget that you sent that transport in the first place). It can be extra useful if combined with queued orders - drive to the passenger, pick up, drive off to somewhere else with the passenger on board.

data.title: Restart button for multiplayer relpays
data.body:
Right now (playtest-20170930) the restart button during a replay is only available for single player replays. I dug in the code a bit and found that there is a condition:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/78bedb0513d0444963f9bf9a59f849b1b0c81974/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/Logic/Ingame/IngameMenuLogic.cs#L100

That makes sense for live games but not in the context of replays.

Often times I find myself wanting to restart a replay (cause I missed something or just to see the match from a different perspective). And with the current setup I'd have to go through all the motions of the menu and finding the replay.

I can see a couple of tickets about desyncs when restarting replays (#12523 and #13312). Is there a reason for not enabling it for multiplayer replays?

data.title: Making "privateer" actors?
data.body:
I apologize in advance if something like this was brought up already; I don't know how other people would phrase what I'm describing. I've also been very out-of-the-loop with OpenRA lately, sadly.

What I mean by "privateer" (and there's probably a better name) is like, making units that use a color unused by anyone playing in the match, so you don't know who sent them to you. For example, Red vs Blue vs Green. Privateer units would be gray. Gray units end up attacking one of those teams, but they won't know which team sent them, unless something gives it away, like what kind of unit besides riflemen.

This would only especially be useful in diplomacy-powered matches, where alliances can be switched around between players; allowing allies to attack each other.

Alternatively, units color-disguised as any of the other teams. Put on a large map, also with diplomacy settings, you can make the other team decide to switch against their partners (at least useful enough for creative game tactics with AI players rather than human ones).

data.title: Yaks get stuck
data.body:
In the latest playtest 20170930 I noticed some strange behavior of the Yaks:
I play as Ukraine, build only one air field and queue up some Yaks. Once two Yaks are built, I deplete their ammo so they try to go back to the air field. But none of the two Yaks actually land on the air field, but they keep staying mid air. When the next Yak in the queue is ready, it does not appear on the empty air field, but it only says "ready" and can't be cancelled any more.

So it seems the air field is blocked by one of the two flying Yaks which can't land for some reasons (this seems to be the initial bug to me).
A new Yak does not appear despite the air field being empty and the queue can't be emptied any more (is this also a bug?)

I saw this twice on the new playtest.

data.title: D2K: When started with 2500$, AIs build three power plants, nothing else
data.body:
In 20170923 playtest all three AIs can not compete after 2500$ start. They build three wind traps without base, then stop doing anything at all. If a wind trap is destroyed, they build another one.

If started with 5000$, they work as intended. Will test latest playtest tomorrow.

data.title: Exit Types
data.body:
Most work was done by @atlimit8. I just solved merge conflicts, changed few tags in yaml files and got rid of issue with blocked exit point.

In the linked issue you can find more details about the whole process. Also I know that my solution for issue with blocked exit is not exactly the best. So if anyone knows about better way, I am open to suggestions. 

I tested the code in ra, d2k, cnc and ts. I have been running AI only (8-12 bots) skirmishes, normal offline skirmish with one human player (me) and on a makeshift testing map with me and sometimes one bot.

I used default settings for everything apart from money and time, which I set to highest and fastest respectively.  


In response to issue:
#14065

data.title: Walls should require BaseProvider
data.body:
Walls currently don't require BaseProvider, which allows players to exploit game mechanics by building walls far away from an MCV. 
There are a couple ways I've seen this play out. 1) A player can use it by dropping a rax or power plant and moving on, then walling off a choke. 2) A player can hinder an advance after losing their MCV if buildings are still nearby. 

From IRC: 
```
[20:24:23] | <pchote> Smitty_: allowing walls to go outside the build radius was a deliberate decision
[20:24:33] | <pchote> for reasons that were good at the time, but which I honestly can't remember now
[20:24:52] | <pchote> and which may no longer apply
[20:25:33] | <pchote> possibly that the line build logic couldn't easily be made to handle the various edge cases around it
```
I've tested walls with BaseProvider. Placing them along the periphery worked as expected. #12754 still comes into play from walls outside but that's a separate issue. 
If anyone can remember the reason BaseProvider wasn't applied let me know. If the previous issue is no longer relevant I'd like to go ahead and fix this.

data.title: Attack helicopters will ignore orders if given queued attacks during rearming.
data.body:
Hind & Longbow:
If you queue up attack orders on structures while the hind or longbow is returning to rearm. They'll ignore all commands after rearming and suicide toward the queued targets.

To reproduce:
∙Build a hind or longbow in RA.
∙Attack an enemy structure.
∙While your air unit is returning to rearm, queue an attack order on a different structure. 
∙After the helicopter has rearmed it should pursue the newly queued target. You will be unable to stop this attack and your helicopter will ignore all orders to stop. 

--
release-20170527 & playtest-20170930

data.title: openSUSE package does not clean up /var/games/openra/ModMetadata on update
data.body:
which junks up the folder pretty much:

```
matthias@mPad-X230:/var/games/openra/ModMetadata> ls
cnc-git-.yaml               cnc-playtest-20170827.yaml  d2k-playtest-20170722.yaml  ra-git-.yaml               ra-playtest-20170827.yaml
cnc-playtest-20170722.yaml  d2k-git-.yaml               d2k-playtest-20170827.yaml  ra-playtest-20170722.yaml
```

Not sure how bad this is.

Uninstall works fine, but only cleans up the files from the current install not the previous updates:

```
matthias@mPad-X230:/var/games/openra/ModMetadata> ls
cnc-playtest-20170722.yaml  d2k-playtest-20170722.yaml  ra-playtest-20170722.yaml
cnc-playtest-20170827.yaml  d2k-playtest-20170827.yaml  ra-playtest-20170827.yaml
```

data.title: Redundant condition in SwallowActor.cs
data.body:
Full disclosure, it is possible that campaign mode actually uses this in some way. However, at very least in skirmish mode, this condition is unnecessary.

https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/64afe4cfdec6494758be82e9dd72b5c411388ba0/OpenRA.Mods.D2k/Activities/SwallowActor.cs#L152-L156

Since the `sandworm.WormInfo.ChanceToDisappear` has value of 100. the condition always evaluates to true and the worm always disappears. As I said, it is possible it has some use I'm not aware of, but from here it looks like waste of resources.
